case_body_condition: Not recognizable - Partial remains with soft tissues
case_circumstances: These remains were found 200 feet from the water line in an area known as Lover's Cove, Calville Bay, Lake Mead National Recreation Area. Receipts recovered from the scene suggest the decedent was in/around Houston, Texas between October-November 1987. On 12/12/87, a 1973 MGB convertible, bearing Oklahoma plates (AT 1692) was towed from the Calville Bay parking lot. Recovered from the scene was a Davis Industries Model D-32, double barrel Derringer pistol.
fingerprints: Fingerprint information is currently not available
case_clothing_with_body: Gray jacket, brown belt, green socks
case_footwear: Black boots that had a vertical zipper on the inner surfaces
case_eyewear: Man's prescription clear glasses with wire frames
case_other_items_with_body: Red handkerchief, a small, blue FM Sony Walkman radio, red nylon bag, leather carrying case for a firearm
dental: Dental information / charting is available and entered
documents: There are currently no documents available for this case.
